revised_title: The Effect of Organic Fluids on the Cultivation of Tubercle Bacillus
tldr: The author investigates the use of organic fluids, such as aqueous vapors from the ground and human breath, as media for cultivating the tubercle bacillus. They found that these fluids can support the growth of the bacillus, and that fresh air and sunlight can disinfect the bacillus in the presence of sufficient organic material. This research provides insights into the conditions that contribute to the spread of tuberculosis and suggests ways to prevent infection.
